content: By 2018, after 10 of the most difficult years in the company's history, we had reduced our debt by more than 65% to $127 million. As we look at the balance sheet, we ended the quarter with $45 million in cash, and our net debt-to-EBITDA ratio continued to drop, currently standing at 0.6x. In the second quarter, we spent $2.1 million via our quarterly $0.05 dividend, delivering a 7.6% yield based on our stock price as of June 30.
